Sgurr Ban

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgurr Ban is an extremely remote Munro in the Fisherfield Forest region. It can be reached during an epic walk from Kinlochewe, or approached via Loch a'Bhraoin, but is more usually ascended from Shenavall bothy.

 You have not climbed Sgurr Ban.

Region: Ullapool

Altitude: 989 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.22/5
Rating: 3.2/5 (32 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The Fisherfield 6, from Shenavall

Other routes and challenges

Whilst the route given above is a real classic, Sgurr Ban can be ascended by a route from Kinlochewe to the south, usually heading in via the Heights of Kinlochewe before wild-camping near the foot of Loch Fhada. Mullach Coire Mhic Fhearchair is usually climbed on both the way out and the return.

The vast quartzite slabs sweeping down to Loch an Nid have been known to attract adventurous scramblers (in dry conditions) undeterred by the remote location.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Ullapool Hotels

Ullapool B&B

Ullapool Cottages

Ullapool & Assynt Hostels
